natural problem: What is the range of the function $$G(x) = |x+1|-|x-1|~?$$Express your answer in interval notation.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes G :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>x. G x = abs (x + 1) - abs (x - 1)"
shows  "range G = {-2..2}"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the range of the function $$G(x) = |x+1|-|x-1|~?$$Express your answer in interval notation. The final Answer is [-2,2]
 ### Proof
 We have $$G(x) = \begin{cases} -(x+1)+(x-1) &\text{if }x<-1 \\ (x+1)+(x-1) &\text{if }-1\le x<1 \\ (x+1)-(x-1) &\text{if }x\ge 1 \end{cases}.$$Simplifying, we have $$G(x) = \begin{cases} -2 &\text{if }x<-1 \\
 2x &\text{if }-1\le x<1 \\ 2 &\text{if }x\ge 1 \end{cases}.$$Therefore, the range of $G(x)$ is $\boxed{[-2,2]}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes G :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>x. G x = abs (x + 1) - abs (x - 1)"
shows  "range G = {-2..2}"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the range of the function $G(x) = |x + 1| - |x - 1|$. The final answer is $[-2, 2]$.

theorem
fixes G :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. G x = abs (x + 1) - abs (x - 1)"
shows  "range G = {-2..2}"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: The function G is defined as G(x) = |x + 1| - |x - 1| for all real numbers x. What is the range of this function G? The final answer is the interval from -2 to 2, inclusive.

a_2.formal problem:

fixes x :: real and G :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. G x = abs(x + 1) - abs(x - 1)"
shows  "G ` UNIV = {-2..2}"

 *)

fixes x :: real and G :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. G x = abs(x + 1) - abs(x - 1)"
shows  "G ` UNIV = {-2..2}"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer

 *)
